instructions: Cook pasta according to package instructions. While the pasta is cooking, make the pesto sauce. In a food processor or blender, combine the basil, garlic, pine nuts, parmesan cheese, salt, and pepper. Pulse until the mixture is finely chopped. With the food processor or blender still running, slowly drizzle in the olive oil until the sauce is smooth and well combined. Drain the pasta and return it to the pot. Add the pesto sauce and stir until the pasta is well coated. Serve the pesto pasta with additional parmesan cheese and a sprinkle of pine nuts, if desired.

Preheat oven to 375°F. Place salmon fillet in a baking dish. Squeeze the juice of the lemon over the salmon. Mince garlic and sprinkle over the salmon. Sprinkle salt and black pepper over the salmon.Bake for 15-20 minutes, or until the salmon flakes easily with a fork

Preheat grill to medium-high heat. In a small bowl, mix together olive oil, juice from half the lemon, minced garlic, salt, and black pepper. Brush the chicken with the olive oil mixture. Grill the chicken for 6-8 minutes per side, or until the internal temperature reaches 165°F.

Heat the oil in a large wok or skillet over high heat. Add the vegetables and stir-fry for 3-5 minutes, or until they art tender-crisp. Serve hot over rice or noodles. In a small bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, honey, and cornstarch. Add the sauce to the vegetables and stir to coat. Cook for an additional 1-2 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened.

Preheat oven to 400°F. Cut vegetables into bite-sized pieces and spread them out in a single layer on a baking sheet. Drizzle olive oil over the vegetables and sprinkle with salt and black pepper. Toss the vegetables to coat with the oil and seasonings. Roast for 20-30 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are tender and lightly browned. Serve hot as a side dish or use in salads or sandwiches.

In a large pot, sauté the onions, carrots, and celery in olive oil over medium heat until the onions are translucent. Add the chicken broth and bring to a simmer. Add the chicken breasts and simmer for 20-30 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through. Remove the chicken from the pot and shred it with two forks. Return the shredded chicken to the pot and add the egg noodles. Simmer for an additional 10-15 minutes, or until the noodles are cooked. Serve hot with chopped parsley and a squeeze of lemon juice.

Preheat oven to 400°F. Wash the potatoes and poke several holes in them with a fork. Rub the potatoes with olive oil and sprinkle with salt. Place the potatoes on a baking sheet and bake for 45-60 minutes, or until they are tender when pierced with a fork. Slice open the potatoes and top with butter, sour cream, and chopped chives.

Preheat a large skillet over medium-high heat.Cut the chicken or beef into thin strips and season with salt, black pepper, chili powder, and cumin.Add the meat to the skillet and cook until browned and cooked through, about 5-7 minutes.Remove the meat from the skillet and set aside.In the same skillet, add sliced onions and bell peppers and sauté until tender-crisp, about 3-5 minutes.Return the meat to the skillet and toss with the vegetables.Serve hot with warm tortillas, salsa, and guacamole.

Preheat oven to 375°F. In a shallow dish, mix together breadcrumbs, Parmesan cheese, and dried herbs. Dip the chicken breasts in beaten egg, then coat with the breadcrumb mixture. Place the chicken breasts in a baking dish and bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through. Top the chicken breasts with marinara sauce and shredded mozzarella cheese. Bake for an additional 5-10 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly. Serve hot with spaghetti or a side salad.

In a large pot or Dutch oven, brown the beef in olive oil over medium-high heat. Remove the beef from the pot and set aside. Add onions, carrots, and celery to the pot and sauté until the onions are translucent. Add minced garlic and sauté for an additional 1-2 minutes. Return the beef to the pot and add beef broth, diced tomatoes, potatoes, and herbs. Bring the mixture to a simmer and cook for 1-2 hours, or until the beef is tender and the vegetables are cooked through. Serve hot with crusty bread or over mashed potatoes.

In a large skillet, cook ground beef or turkey over medium-high heat until browned and cooked through. Add taco seasoning and stir to coat. In a large bowl, toss together lettuce, tomatoes, sliced avocado, shredded cheese, and crushed tortilla chips. Top the salad with the cooked meat mixture. Serve with salsa and sour cream.

Preheat oven to 375°F. In a small bowl, mix together chopped spinach, crumbled feta cheese, minced garlic, and black pepper. Cut a pocket in each chicken breast and stuff with the spinach and feta mixture. Place the stuffed chicken breasts in a baking dish and drizzle with olive oil. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through. Serve hot with roasted vegetables or a side salad.

In a large pot, sauté chopped onions and garlic in olive oil until translucent. Add peeled and diced butternut squash, diced apples, vegetable broth, and herbs. Bring the mixture to a simmer and cook for 20-25 minutes, or until the squash is tender. Using an immersion blender or a regular blender, puree the soup until smooth. Add heavy cream and stir to combine. Serve hot with crusty bread or a side salad.

Preheat oven to 400°F. In a small bowl, whisk together honey, Dijon mustard, minced garlic, and dried thyme. Place salmon fillets in a baking dish and brush with the honey mustard mixture. Bake for 12-15 minutes, or until the salmon is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork. Serve hot with steamed vegetables or a side salad.

In a large pot or Dutch oven, sauté chopped onions and minced garlic in butter until translucent. Add sliced mushrooms and sauté until the mushrooms are tender and browned. Add Arborio rice and stir to coat with the butter and mushroom mixture. Add white wine and stir until the liquid is absorbed. Add chicken broth, one ladleful at a time, stirring constantly until each addition of broth is absorbed. Continue adding broth and stirring until the rice is tender and the risotto is creamy. Stir in grated Parmesan cheese and black pepper. Serve hot with a side salad or steamed vegetables.

Slice fresh tomatoes and fresh mozzarella cheese into thin rounds. Arrange the tomato and mozzarella slices on a plate, alternating between the two. Sprinkle with fresh basil leaves and drizzle with olive oil and balsamic vinegar. Season with salt and black pepper, to taste. Serve cold as a refreshing appetizer or side dish.

Preheat oven to 375°F. In a large bowl, cream together softened butter, white sugar, and brown sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs, one at a time, then stir in vanilla extract. In a separate bowl, mix together flour, baking soda, and salt. Add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and mix until just combined. Stir in chocolate chips. Drop tablespoonfuls of dough onto a baking sheet and bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown. Allow the cookies to cool for a few minutes on the baking sheet, then transfer them to a wire rack to cool completely. Enjoy warm or at room temperature with a cold glass of milk.

In a small bowl, mix together soy sauce, honey, minced garlic, and cornstarch. Thinly slice beef against the grain and season with salt and black pepper. Heat a large skillet or wok over high heat and add vegetable oil. Add the beef to the skillet and stir-fry until browned on all sides. Remove the beef from the skillet and set aside. Add sliced vegetables (such as bell peppers, onions, and broccoli) to the skillet and stir-fry until tender. Return the beef to the skillet and add the soy sauce mixture. Cook for an additional 1-2 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened. Serve hot over rice or noodles.

Spread softened butter on one side of each slice of bread. Place slices of cheese between two slices of bread, with the buttered sides facing out. Heat a nonstick skillet over medium heat. Place the sandwich in the skillet and cook until the bread is golden brown and the cheese is melted. Flip the sandwich over and cook until the other side is golden brown. Serve hot with tomato soup or potato chips.
